data.prayer: Father, we pray the believers are good spiritual stewards of their everyday relationships in Vavuniya, Sri Lanka.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Vavuniya, Sri Lanka
data.section_summary: What beauty can God be thanked for in this photo?

data.prayer: Jesus, help the church in the state of Vavuniya to not rely on buildings or programs, but on your Spirit and the simple faithfulness of every believer.
Father, we pray that the people of Vavuniya, Sri Lanka will learn to study the Bible, understand it, obey it, and share it.
Jesus, you are the great high priest, please make the 5 believers in Vavuniya, Sri Lanka a worthy priesthood under you.
data.verse: Since then we have a great high priest who has passed through the heavens, Jesus, the Son of God, let us hold fast our confession.

data.prayer: Lord, remember the Sayyid people. Make the Sayyid people a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for your own possession.
Father, please reward those who diligently seek you with a heart of faith in the state of Vavuniya.
data.verse: Without faith it is impossible to be well pleasing to him, for he who comes to God must believe that he exists, and that he is a rewarder of those who seek him.

data.prayer: Spirit, how will they hear without a preacher? How will they preach unless they have a Bible? Please give the people in the state of Vavuniya access to a Bible in their own language.
data.verse: How, then, can they call on the one they have not believed in? And how can they believe in the one of whom they have not heard? And how can they hear without someone preaching to them? And how can anyone preach unless they are sent? As it is written: “How beautiful are the feet of those who bring good news!”

data.prayer: Jesus, please find the broken hearted among the 60,200 souls in Vavuniya and mend their wounds.
data.verse: He heals the brokenhearted and binds up their wounds.

location.name: Vavuniya
location.people_groups_list: Sri Lanka Moor, Parsee, Paraiyan (Hindu traditions), Yadav (Hindu traditions), Pidayne Danno
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Sri Lanka Moor (676,000), Parsee (700), Paraiyan (Hindu traditions) (102,000), Yadav (Hindu traditions) (7,300), Pidayne Danno (8,800)
